qas.question: Where do the superior artists and scientists of Mexico City have the option to attend?
What must members of El Colegio Nacional do?

answers.text: publicly disclose their works through conferences and public events

qas.question: What is El Colegio Nacional modeled after?

context: A special case is that of <a1_0>El Colegio Nacional<a1_0/>, created during the district's governmental period of <a0_0>Miguel Alemán Valdés<a0_0/> to have, in Mexico, an institution similar to the <a3_0>College of France<a3_0/>. The select and privileged group of Mexican scientists and artists belonging to this institution—membership is for life—include, among many, Mario Lavista, Ruy Pérez Tamayo, José Emilio Pacheco, Marcos Moshinsky (d.2009), Guillermo Soberón Acevedo. Members are obligated to <a2_0>publicly disclose their works through conferences and public events<a2_0/> such as concerts and recitals.
